tours.to: 2 days from Marrakech to Zagoura Desert Tour
tours.titre: BEST 2 DAYS TO ZAGOURA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.titre: 2 DAYS ZAGOURA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 2 day Zagora desert tour from Marrakech. It is a fabulous 2 days / 1 night tour, in which you will visit so many stuning sites in a very short time. Starting the tour from Marrakech. Firstly, we cross the High Atlas Mountains, and the Tizi-N-Tichka pass. Then visit Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah. After that we drive along the Draa Valley, Agdez village, to reach Zagora desert. After that enjoy the camel trekking in sand dunes And also contemplate the magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. As well as spending the night in the desert camp. Furthermore, enjoy the drums music while dancing around the campfire, under starry sky. Then, we start our tour back to Marrakech, stops will be made along the way. Finally, the tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 2 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: Day 1: Marrakech - Ait Ben Hadou Kasbah -Ouarzazate - Agdez - Zagora Desert (6 Hours Drive)
text: We start the 2 day Zagora desert tour from your accommodation or the airport in Marrakech early morning. Then, drive through Tizi N-tichka pass (2260 m. alt), and through various Berber villages. Different stops will be made along the way, to enjoy the panoramic views. We arrive to Ait Ben Hadou Kasbah, enjoy a short hike of the beautiful world heritage site. The Kasbah used as set for various Hollywood epics, like Gladiator and Lawrence of Arabia. In addition to TV series such as Game of Thrones.

After lunch in either Kasbah Ait Ben Haddou or further in Quarzazate. We drive through the Anti Atlas Mountains, the Berber Villages, and along the Draa Valley. Draa Valley is considered the largest palm plantation and also the longest river in Morocco. Finally, we arrive Zagora in the afternoon, you go for a camel trek, on Zagora desert. Watch the spectacular sunset, before you continue to your Sahara desert camp. Where you will enjoy a Moroccan dinner, along with drums entertainment under open sky of shiny stars.

jours.jour: Day 2: Zagora Desert to Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: After an early wake up for a camel ride over the dunes to contemplate the magical sunrise, and a warm Moroccan breakfast. We depart to Ouarzazate 'The Gate Of The Desert'. Where we visit the Taourirt Rasbah, and also the studios where famous movies were shot. Then continue our way back to Marrakech, through Tizi Ntichka pass and the High Atlas mountains.
Finally, your 2 days Zagora desert tour will end by a drop off at your accommodation or the airport in Mamakech.

includes: Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Pick up & drop off at your Raid / Hotel in Marrakech
Private Driver / Guide Speaking English
Night in a Luxury Desert Camp, Private Bathroom
Camel ride (a Camel Per person) or Transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Dinner and Breakfast.

important.text: Bear in mind that 10 Days trip is just a tour itinerary suggestion, if it does not match what you are looking for, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

priceText.text: Varies according to the number of people, the more people joining the tour the less the price gets. Since the transportation payment is fixed, the price will be divided according to the number of people. The price also depends on the quality of the accommodation. Contact us for an exact price.

listes.name: Sarah – United Kingdom
listes.comment: An unforgettable 2-day desert experience! The drive through the High Atlas Mountains was breathtaking, and Ait Ben Haddou was stunning. The camel trek at sunset in Zagora and the night in the desert camp were magical. Our driver was very professional and friendly. Highly recommended!

listes.name: Michael – United States
listes.comment: This tour was perfectly organized from start to finish. We loved the Draa Valley, the camel ride, and the traditional dinner in the desert camp. Sleeping under the stars with drum music was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Excellent value for money.

listes.name: Emma – France
listes.comment: Amazing tour in just two days! The scenery changes were incredible, and the desert camp was comfortable and clean. Watching both sunset and sunrise on camels was truly special. Our guide made the journey informative and enjoyable.

listes.name: Daniel – Germany
listes.comment: A fantastic short desert tour from Marrakech. The long drives were worth it for the beautiful landscapes and the Sahara atmosphere in Zagora. The camp staff were welcoming, the food was delicious, and everything went smoothly. I would definitely do it again!

listes.question: Is The 2 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The two-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 2-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 2-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 3 days from Marrakech to Fes Morocco Desert Tour
tours.titre: BEST 3 DAYS TO FES DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.titre: 3 DAYS FES DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: Morocco tour of 3 days from Marrakech to Fes through the Sahara desert. In these 3 days / 2 nights tour you will visit so many fabulous sites in short time. Including the Atlas mountains, the Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah, Ouarzazate city, the Dades and also Todra gorges. In addition to Merzouga Sahara desert and many Berber villages. Furthermore, you will ride camels to the heart of the desert. Also witness the magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Moreover, you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Finally, the 3 day tour ends in Fes.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 3 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day: Marrakech High Atlas- Ait ben Haddou Kasbah- Roses Vally - Dades Valley (6 Hours Drive)
text: The 3 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour, starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Marrakech. Then drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka pass. Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes.

After that we continue to visit the famous Kasbah of Alt Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in more many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And also TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Ouarzazate. Free time for lunch, then we continue to visit the Rose valley passing through the large palm grove of Skoura. Finally we drive to Boumalne Dades where we spend the night.

jours.jour: 2nd day: Dades Valley - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes Camel trekking overnight in a luxury camp  (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive through the Dades valley, we stop on a spot overlooking the valley, to enjoy the spectacular landscape of Dades gorges. Then we continue to Todra Gorges, the course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains -Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. After that we drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Free time for lunch on the way.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 3rd day: Merzouga Dunes Erfoud Midelt cedars forest - Ifigne-Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 3 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour. Wake up early morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you return on camels to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation in Fes. End of the 3 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour
This Tour Ends in Fes, if you wish to Travel Back to Marrakech, you can Consider: 3 Days From Marrakech to Merzouga
The Tour Is Available in Reverse as well: Fes to Marrakech 3 Days Tour

includes: Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Pick up & drop off at your Raid / Hotel in Marrakech
Private Driver / Guide Speaking English
1 Night in a Luxury Desert Camp, Private Bathroom
1 Night in an Excellent Hotel / Raid
Sand boards Available at The Camp
Camel ride (a Camel Per person) or Transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Dinner and Breakfast.

tours.to: 3 days from Marrakech to Merzouga Desert Tour
tours.titre: BEST 3 DAYS TO MERZOUGA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.titre: 3 DAYS MERZOUGA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 3 day desert tour from Marrakech to Merzouga, In these 3 days 12 nights tour you will visit so many amazing sites in a very short time. Including the Ait-Ben-Haddou Kasbah, Ouarzazate city, the Dades and also Todra gorges. In addition to Merzouga Sahara desert, Draa valley and many Berber villages. Furthermore enjoy the spectacular landscapes of the High Atlas mountains. And ride camels to the heart of the desert. Also witness the magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Finally the tour end in Marrakech

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 3 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day: Marrakech - High Atlas mountains - Alt Ben Haddou Kasbah - Roses Valley - Boumalne Dades (6 Hours Drive)
text: The 3 days Tour to Merzouga desert starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Marrakech, Then drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and also Tizi-N-Tichka pass. Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes

After that, we continue to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And also TV series Including Game Of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Ouarzazate. Free time for lunch, then we continue to visit the Rose valley passing through the large palm grove of Skoura. Finally we drive to Boumalne Dades where we spend the night.

jours.jour: 2nd day: Dades Valley - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Sahara Desert - Camel trekking-overnight in a luxury camp (5 Hours Drive)
text: On the second day of your Morocco desert tour, we drive through the Dades valley, we stop on a spot overlooking valley, to enjoy the spectacular landscape of Dades gorges. Then we continue to Todra Gorges, the course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains-Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. After that we drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Free time for lunch on the way

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 3rd day: Merzouga Sahara Desert - Draa Valley-Anti Atlas Mountains - Ouarzazate - Marrakech (9 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Then you will have a free time for a warm Moroccan breakfast. After that you return on camels or the camp's 4x4 to Merzouga where your driver awaits. Then we continue to Rissani town, well know for its ethnic large souk. After that we continue to Alnif then along the Draa valley all the way to Ouarzazate. Then we cross the Tizi-n-Tichka pass to reach Marrakech. Finally, the 3 days desert tour ends by a drop off at your accommodation in Marrakech.
note: Note : If the 9 hour drive back to Marrakech feels too much for you, the tour can end in Errachidia airport, 2 hours from Merzouga, and it is one hour flight to Marrakech. (flight is not Included), Airline: Ryanair, schedule: 3 Times a week
If you wish to Finish the tour in Fes instead of Marrakech, you can consider: 3 Days From Marrakech to Fes

tours.to: 4 days from Marrakech to Fes Via Desert Tour
tours.titre: BEST 4 DAYS TO FES VIA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.titre: 4 DAYS FES VIA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 4 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour. In this 4 day/3 night tour you will visit so many amazing sites. Including the Atlas mountains, the Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah, Ouarzazate city, the Dades and also Todra gorges. In addition to Merzouga Sahara desert and many Berber villages. Ride camels to the heart of the desert. Also witness the magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Finally, the tour ends in Fes.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 4 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day: Marrakech - High Atlas mountains - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah-Ouarzazate - Rose Valley -Boumalne Dades (6 Hours Drive)
text: The 4 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Marrakesh. Then drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka pass, Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes.

After that we continue to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator. Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And also TV series including Game of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Ouarzazate, visit the Atlas Studio where famous movies were shot. Then continue to Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May, where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. Then we drive to Boumalne dades, Dinner and overnight in a hotel or a Riad

jours.jour: 2nd day: Boumalne Dades - Todra Gorges - Erfoud -Merzouga Sahara - overnight in a luxury camp  (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, enjoy the spectacular landscape of Dades gorges. Then we continue to Todra Gorges, the course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Free time for lunch. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 3rd day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads -Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the day to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly, we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving of rood to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlla village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music, and dancing performances, Its inhabitants are eriginating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in a palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called (lamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 4th day: Merzouga Dunes-Erfoud-Midelt -Cedars forest-Ifrane-Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 4 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour. We leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation in Fes. End of the 4 Day tour
note: Note : This Tour Ends in Fes, if you wish to Travel Back to Marrakech, you can Consider: 4 Days From Marrakech to Merzouga
You Can As Well do the tour in Reverse : 4 Days Trip From Fes to Marrakech

reviews.titre: REVIEWS : 4 DAYS TO FES VIA DESERT TOUR

listes.name: Isabella – Italy
listes.comment: An amazing 4-day adventure across Morocco! The journey through the Atlas Mountains, Ait Ben Haddou, and the Sahara desert was breathtaking. Camel trekking and the desert camp were highlights of the trip.

listes.name: Oliver – United Kingdom
listes.comment: This tour was perfectly organized. We loved exploring the Todra Gorges, Rissani market, and the cedar forest with Barbary macaques. The desert sunset and sunrise were magical experiences.

listes.name: Sophia – France
listes.comment: A wonderful way to discover Morocco over four days. The combination of mountains, desert, and Berber villages made this tour unforgettable. Comfortable hotels and a fantastic guide made everything smooth and enjoyable.

listes.name: Liam – Germany
listes.comment: One of the best tours we did in Morocco. Every stop was amazing, from the Merzouga dunes to Ifrane and the cedar forest. Camel rides, desert campfire, and traditional music made this experience truly special.

faqs.titre: FAQS : 4 DAYS TO FES VIA DESERT TOUR

listes.question: Is The 4 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The four-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 4-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 4-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 4 days from Marrakech to Merzouga Desert Tour
tours.titre: BEST 4 DAYS MERZOUGA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.titre: 4 DAYS MERZOUGA DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 4 day Morocco desert tour from Marrakech to Merzouga, in these 4 days 3 nights you will visit so many amazing sites in a short time, licluding: the high Atlas mountains, the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, the Ait-Ben Haddou Kasbah and also Ouarzazate city. In addition to Draa valley the longest river in Morocco, as well as Rissani town and Merzouga Sahara desert. Furthermore, you will ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise, and spend the night in a desert camp as well. Then we visit the Dades valley, Todra gorges and also Amridil Kasbah. Finally the tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 4 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day: Marrakech - High Atlas mountains - Ounila Valley - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah-Ouarzazate (4 Hours Drive)
text: The 4 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Marrakesh. Then drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka pass, Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes.

After that we continue to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator. Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And also TV series including Game of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Ouarzazate, visit the Atlas Studio where famous movies were shot. Then continue to Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May, where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. Then we drive to Boumalne dades, Dinner and overnight in a hotel or a Riad

jours.jour: 2nd day: Ouarzazate-Agdz-Draa Valley - Nkob -Rissani - Merzouga Desert - Camel trekking-overnight in a luxury camp (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we explore the city of Ouarzazate. Firstly, we visit the Atlas studios, where various famous movies were shot. Then visit the Taourirt Kasbah: an ancient fortifled mud castle. After that we depart towards Agdz, and join the Draa Valley the longest river in Morocco. We will drive along it, and stop for panoramic views of the palm trees groves, spectacular Kasbahs and Berber villages. Free time for lunch in Nkob or Alnif.

After lunch, we continue to the Sahara desert of Merzouga through Rissani. When we reach the Erg Chebbi sand dunes you switch to comels, to cross the Sahara desert. A stop will be made for you on top of a big dune to observe the magical sunset. Then continue to the camp which is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads and the luxury a hotel has. In the campsite you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under open sky of shiny stars. Dinner and Overnight stay in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Boumalne Dades (5 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you return on camels to Merzouga where the driver awaits. We leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.

After a stroll in Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Then inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation. And on spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 4th day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura-Amridil Kasbah -High Atlas Mountains -Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: On last day of your 4-day desert tour from Marrakech, we continue to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose volley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. Then we drive along various Kasbahs, including Amridil Kasbah surrounded by the palm trees grove of Skoura. We rench Quarzazate, free time for lunch in town. Then we continue to Marrakech by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the High Atlas Mountains. Finally, we drop you off at your accommodation or the airport in Marrakech. End the tour
This Tour Ends in Marrakech, if you wish to Travel to Fes, you can Consider: 4 Days Tour From Marrakech to Fes

about.titre: 5 DAYS FES DESERT TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 5 days tour from Marrakech to Fes through the Sahara desert in these 5 days / 4 nights you will visit so many amazing sites. Including: the high Atlas mountains, the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, the Ait-Ben-Haddou Kasbah and Ouarzazate city. In addition to Amridil Kasbah, Dades valley and Todra gorges. Also visit Merzouga Sahara desert. Where ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Explore the Sahara desert of Merzouga in a 4x4 car. Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Finally, the tour ends in Fes.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 5 DAYS TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

jours.jour: Ist day: Marrakech-High Atlas mountains - Tizi N Tichka pass-Ait Ben Haddou Kashah-Ouarzazate (4 Hours Drive)
text: The 5 days Marrakech to fes desert tour starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Marrakesh. Then drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka pass. Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes. Then we visit the Kasbah of Telouat.

After that we continue to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy.etc. And also TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Quarzazate. Dinner and overnight stay in a hotel

jours.jour: 2nd day: Quarzazate-Palm groves of Shoura-Amridil Kasbah-Rose valley -Dades Valley (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we explore the city of Ouarzazate. Firstly, we visit the Atlas studios, where various famous movies were shot, and also visit the Taourirt Kasbah -A fortified mud castle, and one of the most ancient and spectacular Ksars in Morocco. After that we drive east to visit Amridil Kasbah surrounded by palm groves in Skoura. Then continue to Kalaa Magouna famous for the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May, where the locals offer their rose products, from: perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. Then we drive to Dades valley through Boumalne Dades, Inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation, and on a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades valley. Dinner and overnight in a hotel in Boumalne Dades.

jours.jour: 3rd day: Boumalne Dades - Todra Gorges - Erfoud -Merzouga Sahara - Overnight in a Luxury Camp (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue the 5 days desert tour to Todra Gorges, the course of Tod river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains-Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Then drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad, Free time for lunch on the way.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dane. Then continue to the desert luxury camp. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the comp.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Explore Merzouga Region - Nomads -Khamlia-Merzouga lake Erg Chebbi - Desert Oasis (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the day to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils arens to fabulous oases, Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities

Firstly, we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music, and dancing performances. Its inhabitants are originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in a palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 5th day: Merzouga Dunes - Erfoud - Midelt -cedars forest-Ifrane-Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 5 days Marrakech to Fes desert tour. You wake up early morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you retum on camels or via the Camp's 4x4 to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading cent in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco, Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation in Fes. End of the tour

includes: Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Pick up & drop off at your Raid / Hotel in Marrakech
Private Driver / Guide Speaking English
1 Night in a Luxury Desert Camp, Private Bathroom
3 Night in an Excellent Hotel / Raid
Sand boards Available at The Camp
Camel ride (a Camel Per person) or Transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Desert Excursion in 4×4
Dinner and Breakfast.
Drop Off at your Riad in Fes

important.text: Bear in mind that 10 Days trip is just a tour itinerary suggestion, if it does not match what you are looking for, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

priceText.text: Varies according to the number of people, the more people joining the tour the less the price gets. Since the transportation payment is fixed, the price will be divided according to the number of people. The price also depends on the quality of the accommodation. Contact us for an exact price.

listes.name: Liam – United Kingdom
listes.comment: Amazing 5-day tour from Marrakech to Fes! The landscapes, desert camel rides, and Berber culture were unforgettable. Highly recommended.

listes.name: Emma – France
listes.comment: Perfectly planned tour! From Ait Ben Haddou to Merzouga desert and Ifrane, each day was filled with incredible sights and experiences.

listes.name: Noah – Germany

listes.name: Sophia – Canada

listes.name: Oliver – Australia
listes.comment: Incredible journey across Morocco! The mix of mountains, desert, palm groves, and traditional villages made it unforgettable. Everything was well organized.

listes.question: Is The 5 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The five-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 5-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 5-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

Finally, explore Fes one of the imperial cities of Morocco. The 6 days tour from Marrakech ends in Fes.

Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in more many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And also TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we head to The gate of the desert Ouarzazate. Free time for lunch, then we continue to visit the Rose valley passing through the large palm grove of Skoura. Finally we drive to Boumalne Dades where we spend the night.

jours.jour: 2nd day: Dades Valley - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes Camel trekking overnight in a luxury comp (5 Hours Drive)

Then we continue to Todra Gorges, the course of Todra riyer has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains Making a high red cliff sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. After that we drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Free time for lunch on the way.

in the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to comels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. jours.jour: 3rd day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads -Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble

Finally, Night in Fes, Free evening in the Medina

jours.jour: 5th day: Guided tour sightseeing Fes ()
text: We'll pick you up from your accommodation in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities-Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine considered the oldest existing university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to Relax

jours.jour: 6th day: Transfer to the airport (30 Min Drive)
text: Depending on your flight time, we will pick you up from the Raid and Drive to Fes Airport.
End of the Morocco Desert Tour From Marrakech

about.titre: 8 DAYS ESSENTIAL MOROCCO TOUR FROM MARRAKECH
about.paragraph1: 8 day Essential Morocco tour from Marrakech to Fes and Chefchaouen via the Sahara desert. During these 8 days 17 nights you will visit so many amazing sites. Including the high Atlas mountains, the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, the Ait-Ben-Haddou Kasbah and Ouarzazate city. In addition to Amridil Kasbah, Dades valley and Todra gorges. Also visit Merzouga Sahara desert. Where ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Explore the Sahara desert of Merzouga in a 4x4 car. Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Explore Fes and Meknes two of the imperial cities of Morocco. Visit the Roman ruins of Volubilis and the blue city of Chefchaouen. Finally, the tour ends in Tangier.

jours.jour: 7th day: Fes - Meknes - Volubilis ruins -Chefchaouen (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we depart to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Free time for lunch. Next we drive 30 km away from Meknesto visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways.

After strolling in the ruins, we head north through Ouazzane, to reach Chefchaouen in the Rif Mountains. Also known as the Blue city. The city is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in blue. Overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 8th day: Transfer to the Tangier airport (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, depending on your flight time, you can have a free time to stroll in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city, before we drive through the Rif mountains to reach Tangier, then we transfer you to the airport. End of the 8 days tour.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 10 days Morocco Grand Tour
tours.titre: 10 DAYS MOROCCO GRAND TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: Morocco 10 days grand tour from Marrakech and Essaouira to Fes and Chefchaouen through the Sahara desert. In these 10 days / 9 nights visit so many amazing sites. Including : the Highlights of Marrakech and Essaouira, the high Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-tichka pass. As well as visiting the Ait-Ben-Haddou Kasbah, dades valley and Todra gorges. Also visit Merzouga Sahara desert. Where you ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Also explore the Sahara desert of Merzouga in a 4x4 car.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaques live. Explore Fes and Meknes two of the imperial cities of Morocco. Visit the Roman ruins of Volubilis and the blue city of Chefchaouen. Finally, the tour ends in Tangier.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 10 DAYS TOUR OF MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day : Arrival to Marrakech( 15 Min Drive )
text: The 10 day Morocco trip begins with a pickup from Marrakech airport, followed by a brief drive through the city of Marrakech. Afterward, you'll be transferred to your accommodation for an overnight stay in a traditional riad.

jours.jour: 2ed day : Arrival to Marrakech( 3 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we head west toward the coastal city of Essaouira. Along the way, we'll stop to visit an Argan tree plantation and a local cooperative. If you're lucky, you might even spot goats climbing the trees! We'll also pause for panoramic views before arriving in Essaouira-formerly known as Mogador-one of Morocco's most charming coastal towns. Enjoy free time to explore the fishing port, stroll along the ancient ramparts lined with cannons, and wander through the atmospheric old medina. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 3rd day : Essaouira-guided Tour sightseeing Marrakech( 3 hours Drive + 3 hours walking Tour )
text: We return to Marrakech to discover the city's most iconic landmarks with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the grandeur of the Koutoubia Mosque, the largest in the city.

jours.jour: 4th day : Marrakech - High Atlas Mountains - Ait Ben Haddou- Roses Vally- Dades Valley( 6 hours Drive )
text: Drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka, pass. Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes and Berber Villages.

Our next stop is the renowned Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a fortified village and UNESCO World Heritage Site. This iconic site has served as the backdrop for numerous films, including Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy, and popular TV series like Game of Thrones. 40-minute hike to explore the kasbah on foot and enjoy panoramic views from the top.Then we head to 'The gate of the desert' Ouarzazate. Free time for lunch, then we continue to visit the Rose valley passing through the large palm grove of Skoura. Finally we drive to Boumalne Dades where we spend the night. ( Dinner Included)

jours.jour: 5th day : Dades Valley - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes - Camel trekking - overnight in a luxury camp ( 5 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we drive through the scenic Dades Valley, making a stop at a panoramic viewpoint. We then continue to the spectacular Todra Gorges, where the Todra River has carved a dramatic canyon with towering red cliffs. You'll have free time to walk through the gorge and enjoy the natural beauty of this unique setting.
The journey then takes us through the lush palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad, with free time for lunch along the way.

In the afternoon, we arrive in the golden dunes of the Merzouga Sahara Desert, where your camels await. Embark on a peaceful camel trek across the dunes, with a stop atop a high dune to witness the magical desert sunset. You'll then continue to a luxury desert camp, where you'll be welcomed with traditional Berber hospitality. Enjoy dinner, accompanied by Berber drumming and dancing around the campfire. Overnight stay in the camp.

jours.jour: 6th day : Explore Merzouga region - Nomads - Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove ( 2 hours Drive )
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels or a 4x4 ride to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the day to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly, we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off-road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music, and dancing performances. Its inhabitants are originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in a palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a Riad next to the dunes.

jours.jour: 7th day : Merzouga Dunes - Erfoud - Medelt - Cedars forest - Ifrane - Fes ( 7 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble.

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt or on the way. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Finally, night in Fes, free evening in the Medina.

jours.jour: 8th day : Guided tour sightseeing Fes ( 30 Min / 3h to 4h walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your accommodation in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine considered the oldest existing university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to relax.

jours.jour: 9th day : Fes - Meknes - Volubilis ruins - Chefchaouen ( 4 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we depart to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Free time for lunch. Next we drive 30 km away from Meknes to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways.

After exploring the ancient ruins, we continue our journey north through Ouazzane, making our way to Chefchaouen, nestled in the Rif Mountains. Often referred to as the Blue City, Chefchaouen is renowned for its charming streets and buildings painted in various shades of blue. You'll have the evening to relax and soak in the town's unique atmosphere. Overnight stay in a local Riad.

jours.jour: 10th day : Transfer to Tangier Airport ( 2 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we drive through the scenic Rif Mountains en route to Tangier Airport, marking the end of your unforgettable 10 day trip from Marrakech.
Depending on your flight time-you may enjoy some free time to wander through the charming blue-painted alleyways of Chefchaouen or even take a short city tour in Tangier.

tours.to: 4 days In Morocco Tours from Casablanca
tours.titre: BEST 4 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: 4 Days Tour in Morocco, in this 4-day/3-night journey, you'll explore some of Morocco's most iconic destinations. The tour begins with a brief stop in Casablanca, where you can visit the impressive Hassan II Mosque or enjoy a quick stroll along the Corniche, before heading inland. Next, travel to Fes, the cultural capital of Morocco, with time to explore its rich history and vibrant medina. From there, head south through the scenic Middle Atlas Mountains, passing by Ifrane known as the Switzerland of Morocco and the cedar forests of Azrou, where you may spot wild monkeys.
about.paragraph2: Continue toward the Sahara Desert of Merzouga, where you'll experience a magical camel ride across the dunes and spend the night in a luxury desert camp, enjoying the sunset, traditional music, and the starry sky. On the final day, journey through the spectacular Todra and Dades Gorges, visit the UNESCO-listed Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, and cross the majestic High Atlas Mountains via the Tizi n'Tichka Pass. The tour concludes in Marrakesh.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 4 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: Day 1 : Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (3.5 Hours Drive)
text: Your 4 Day journey begins with a pick-up from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca, Morocco's economic capital. You'll start with a visit to the iconic Hassan II Mosque, one of the largest and most impressive mosques in the world.
After the visit, travel inland to the imperial city of Fes. Upon arrival, enjoy a short stop at the Royal Palace Gate, then spend the evening at leisure exploring the medina or relaxing in your Riad.
Overnight stay in a traditional Riad in Fes.

jours.jour: Day 2 : Fes - Ifrane - Cedar Forest - Midelt - Ziz Valley - Merzouga Desert (7 Hours Drive)
text: Afler breakfast, depart fes and drive south through Imouzzer toward the alpine town of Ifrane, often referred to as the Switzerland of Morocco due to its European-style architecture and cool climate. Continue through the Cedar Forest of Azrou, where you may encounter wild Barbary macaques. Later, stop in Midelt for lunch, before crossing the scenic Tizi-n-Tilghmt Pass and the Ziz Valley, with photo stops along the way.

By late afternoon, arrive in the Merzouga Sahara Desert, where you'll ride camels across the golden dunes. Stop atop a high dune to enjoy the sunset, then continue to your luxury desert camp, blending traditional nomadic style with modern comfort.
Enjoy dinner, live Berber music, and stargazing under the vast desert sky.
Overnight in a luxury camp in Merzouga.

jours.jour: Day 3: Merzouga-Rissani - Erfoud-Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Affer Erexifiant, leave the desert and visit Rissant, the former capital of the laplatet region and a vibrant trading center. Explore its traditional souk, especially lively on market days (Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sandays Continue to Erfeud, known for its fossil workshops, then drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Arrive at the dramatic Todra Garges, where the Todra River has carved towering canyons into the mountains, fake time to walk through the gorge and enjoy lunch at a local restaurant. In the aflernson, continue to the Dades Valley via Boumaine Dades, stopping at the famous 'Monkey Fingers' rock formations and a scamic viewpoint ever the valley.
Dinner and overnight in a Riad in the Dudes Valley.

jours.jour: Day 4: Dodes Valley-Rose Valley-Shouru-Ovarzazate - Air Ben Haddou Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, depart for Kalaat M'Gouna, located in the heart of the Rose Valley, known for its annual Rose Festival in May and locally made rose products. Travel through the Skoura Palm Grove, then arrive in Ouarzazate, often called the Hollywood of Africa. Visit the famous film studios where movies like Gladiator and The Mummy were filmed. Next, explore the UNESCO-listed Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a beautifully preserved fortified village featured in Game of Thrones, Gladiator, and more.
In the afternoon, drive across the High Atlas Mountains vin the Tizi-n-Tichka Pass, with stops for photos and lunch Arrive in Marrakech by Late afternoon.
End of the 4 days Morocco tour

tours.to: 5 days In Morocco Itinerary from Casablanca
tours.titre: BEST 5 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: 5 days in Morocco from Casablanca. In these 5 days / 4 nights, you will visit amazing places in Morocco. The tour starts by a visit to Casablanca city, then the Roman ruins of Volubilis and Meknes the Ismaili capital. In addition to Fes the cultural city. Then we head south, visiting the Switzerland of Morocco frane, and also the cedars forest. As well as visiting Midelt, Ziz valley, Rissani traditional market and also Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp, in the middle of the desert. Also enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Thereafter, visit the Todra and Dades gorges, and the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, the 5 Day tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 5 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca (1 Hours Drive)
text: The 5 Day Morocco Tour starts with a pick you up from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca. Casablanca is considered the economical center, and also the largest city in Morocco. Firstly, we will visit the Hassan Il mosque, the largest mosque in Morocco, located on the west coast of the city. It is on a promontory, overlooking the Atlantic ocean. Free time for lunch. Then we explore the city, and also visit the amazing Cornish of Casablanca. Finally, overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 2nd day: Casablanca - the Roman ruins of Volubilis - Meknes-Fes (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, departure from Casablanca to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial city. In which we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary. And the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 3rd day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style architecture houses. No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. With stops for panoramic views.

After that, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga in the afternoon. Where you switch to camels, and cross the sandy desert. You will make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the camp. Which is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads, and the luxury a hotel has. You can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 4th day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand red cliff-sided canyon through the mountains. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. After that, inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation, and for a view of the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 5th day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbak -High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: Finally, we continue our trip to Kalua Magouna, to vait the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May Where the locals offer their rose products. We then drive through the paint groves of Skoura to reach Ouarzazate Where we visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot

We depart to visit the finnous Kathah of Ait Ben Haddou A fortified village recognized as a World Hentage te by UNESCO. Furthermore, the kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Nexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N Tichla pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be muide for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Finally, we reach Marrakech, then we deive you to the airport or your pccommodation. End of your 5 days in Morocca

includes: 5 Days Transport in a private 4x4 or a minivan with A/C +Fuel:
Private Driver Speaking English.
Nights in Excellent Hotels / Riads.
Night in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms
Camel ride (a Camel Per person), or Transfer in a 4x4
Sand boards Available at The Camp
Pick up from Any location in Casablanca (Airport, your Hotel...etc).
Drop Off at your Accommodation in Marrakech
2 Dinners in the Camp & Dades Valley
Daily Breakfasts.

We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

listes.comment: Perfect 5-day itinerary! The mix of cultural cities, desert, and Atlas mountains made it unforgettable. Loved the luxury camp in Merzouga.

listes.comment: Amazing tour! Visiting Fes, Merzouga, Todra & Dades gorges, and ending in Marrakech was a perfect journey. Highly recommend this tour.

listes.name: Emma – Germany
listes.comment: Well-organized tour with a great driver and guide. Camel ride in the Sahara and sunrise in the desert were magical moments.

listes.name: Carlos – Spain
listes.comment: A fantastic experience! Beautiful landscapes, historic cities, and friendly guides. The 5-day tour was compact but very enriching.

listes.question: Is The 5 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The five-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 5-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 7-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

about.paragraph1: 6 Days In Morocco Tour Itinerary from Casablanca to Marrakech. In these 6 days 15 nights, you will visit amazing places in Morocco. The tour starts by a visit to Casablanca the largest city in Morocco. Then visit the Roman ruins of Volubilis and Meknes the Ismaili capital. In addition to Fes the cultural city, and also the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane. Then we head south, visiting the cedars forest, Midelt and the amazing Ziz valley. As well as visiting Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp, in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, and the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, the 6 day tour ends in Marrakech

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 6 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 6 Day in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling civic center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Cafe, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note :the order and number of visits may vary based on your arrieved schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca -The Roman Ruins of Volubilis-Meknes-Fes (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, departure from Casablanca to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as It is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO, It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes. The Ismaili capital and one of the imperial city, in which we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary. And Finally, the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive / 3 Hours walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraoulyine considered the oldest existing university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to Relax.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Fes-Ifrane-Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style architecture houses. No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. With stops for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Then you switch to camels, and cross the sandy desert. After that you will make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the camp. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley  (5 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels or via the camp's 4x4 to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. Thereafter, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large lively souk.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a high red cliff-sided canyon through the mountains. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation, and for the view of the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 6th day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah -High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: Finally, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products. Then we drive through the palm groves of Skoura. We reach Ouarzazate, where we visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

After that we depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. We reach Marrakech around 5pm, then we drive to the airport or your accommodation, End of the 6 days tour in Morocco.
