text: Wake up early to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then return on camels or the camp's 4x4 to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani remains a major trading center in the region with a large souk lively 3 days a week.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud to visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves to reach the Todra Gorges. The Todra river has carved a grand canyon through the mountains. These gorges are ideal for rock climbers. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades, with stops at 'monkey fingers' rock formation and a spot overlooking the valley. Dinner and overnight in a Riad.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Town - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose valley & a Cooperative. A Rose Festival is held annually in May where locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil to cosmetic products. Then we drive through the palm groves of Skoura to reach Ouarzazate and visit Atlas Studios where famous movies were shot.

Thereafter we visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It has appeared in many movies including Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy and TV series like Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops for lunch and photo opportunities. Finally, arrive at Marrakech, then transfer to the airport or your accommodation. End of the 7 day Morocco tour.

includes: 7 Days Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver Speaking English.
Walking Tour in Fes with a Local Guide.
Nights in Excellent Hotels / Riads.
Night in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms.
Camel ride (Camel Per person), or a transfer via a 4WD as an alternative.
Sand boards Available at The Camp.
Pick up from Any location in Casablanca (Airport, your Hotel...etc).
Drop Off at your Accommodation in Marrakech.
2 Dinners in the Camp & Dades Valley.
Daily Breakfasts.

listes.name: Laura M. – USA
listes.comment: The 7-day Morocco tour was absolutely perfect! Our driver Youssef was kind, funny, and very knowledgeable. Chefchaouen and the Sahara night were unforgettable. Everything was well organized from start to finish!

listes.name: Amine B. – France
listes.comment: Super expérience ! Les hébergements étaient très confortables surtout le camp de luxe à Merzouga. Le timing était parfait et nous avons découvert tellement de paysages différents en seulement une semaine.

listes.name: Sophie & Marc – Canada
listes.comment: Nous avons adoré la visite guidée de Fès et le désert. Le coucher de soleil dans les dunes restera un souvenir magique. Le chauffeur parlait très bien anglais et était très attentionné.

listes.name: David R. – UK
listes.comment: Great itinerary for 7 days in Morocco. Very smooth logistics, good hotels and amazing food. We especially enjoyed Ait Ben Haddou and the High Atlas drive. Highly recommended.

listes.name: Chiara P. – Italy
listes.comment: Un viaggio meraviglioso! Ogni giorno una nuova scoperta: Fes, il deserto, le gole del Todra… tutto organizzato alla perfezione. Tornerò sicuramente in Marocco!

listes.question: Is The 7 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The seven-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 7-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?

The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 7-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.

tours.to: 8 days Tour from Casablanca | Morocco Itinerary
tours.titre: BEST 8 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: Morocco in 8 days, tour itinerary from Casablanca. In these 8 days / 7 nights, you will visit so many fabulous places. Starting the tour by visiting the Casablanca city. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, Chefchaouen the blue city. And also the Roman ruins of Volubilis. As well as visiting Meknes the Ismaili capital, Fes the cultural city and the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane. Then we drive south visiting the cedars forest, Midelt, the amazing Ziz valley, and Rissani traditional market.
about.paragraph2: In addition to Erfoud the fossils town and the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you can ride camels and spend the night in a luxury camp in the middle of the desert. Also enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Then walk in the magnificent Todra and Dades gorges. After that visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Thereafter, cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, wander in Marrakech with a local guide. The 8 days Tour in Morocco ends in Casablanca.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 8 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the flest day of your 8 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling civic center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Café, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note :the order and number of visits may vary based on your arrieved schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Chefchaouen (5.5 hours drive)
text: After breakfast,we drive along the coastline to Rabat, one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. Then you will visit the highlights of the city including: The Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and The Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon we head north through Ouazzane, to reach the Blue city of Chefchaouen in the Rif Mountains. The city is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white blue. Overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Chefchaouen- The Roman Ruins of Volubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit the city of Meknes. The city is known as the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities in Morocco. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stable, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive/3hrs to 4hrs walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine existing considered the oldest university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your Riad to relax.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After a warm breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and also the alpine-style architecture houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. Stops will be made along the way for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Then you switch to camels, and cross the sandy desert. You will make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the desert camp. The camp is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads, and the luxury a hotel has. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise In the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you return on camels to Merzouga where the driver awaits. We leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.

After a stroll in Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains making a high red cliff-sided canyon. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation. And on a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kashah -High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura. Later, we reach Ouarzazate, also known as the gate of the desert. We will visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech. Driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and also the spectacular the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Finally, we reach Marrakech, overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 8th Day : Marrakech - Casablanca (3 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, We drive north to Casablanca airport, we will make stops for panoramic views. Then transfer you to the airport . End of the 8 Day Morocco Tour.

Private Driver Speaking English.

tours.to: 10 days In Morocco Tours from Casablanca
tours.titre: BEST 10 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: 10 Day Morocco Tour from Casablanca. In these 10 days /9 nights, you will visit so many fabulous places. Starting the tour by visiting the Casablanca city. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, Chefchaouen the blue city, and also the Roman ruins of Volubilis. As well as visiting Meknes the Ismaili capital, Fes the cultural city and the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane. Then we drive south visiting the cedars forest, Midelt, the amazing Ziz valley, and Rissani traditional market.
about.paragraph2: In addition to Erfoud the fossils town and also the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you can ride camels and spend the night in a luxury camp in the middle of the desert. Also enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Thereafter, walk in the magnificent Todra and Dades gorges. Visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Then roam Marrakech with a local guide. Finally the 10 tour ends in Casablanca.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 10 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 10 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling civic center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Café, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note :the order and number of visits may vary based on your arrieved schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Chefchaouen (5.5 hours drive)
text: After breakfast,we drive along the coastline to Rabat, one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. Then you will visit the highlights of the city including: The Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and The Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon we head north through Ouazzane, to reach the Blue city of Chefchaouen in the Rif Mountains. The city is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white blue. Overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Chefchaouen- The Roman Ruins of Volubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit the city of Meknes. The city is known as the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities in Morocco. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stable, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive/3hrs to 4hrs walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine existing considered the oldest university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your Riad to relax.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After a warm breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and also the alpine-style architecture houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. Stops will be made along the way for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Then you switch to camels, and cross the sandy desert. You will make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the desert camp. The camp is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads, and the luxury a hotel has. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Merzouga Desert Excursion - Nomads Eyeliner mine - Khamlia (Gnawa Village) - Erg Chebbi - Palm groves (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on the camp's 4x4 or the Camels through the Sand dunes to Merzouga (Or you can do ATVs as well with extra costs), where the driver awaits, We dedicate the 6th day of your 10 days Morocco itinerary, to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly, we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off-road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music, and dancing performances. Its inhabitants are originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in a palm trees groves, a modern desert Oasis.
Dinner and overnight in a Riad or the Camp.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.

After a stroll in Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitable stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation. And on a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah -High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech(6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura. Later, we reach Ouarzazate, also known as the gate of the desert. We will visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakesh. Driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Overnight stay in a Riad in Marrakesh.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After a warm breakfast, we will be exploring the Highlights of Marrakesh with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the Koutoubia Mosque from outside, the largest in the city.

Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, meet your driver to visit the iconic Majorelle Garden (requires online pre-booking), followed by a drive through Gueliz, the modern district of Marrakech, before returning to your Riad.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Marrakesh - Casablanca Airport (3 Hours Drive)
text: On the final day, drive north to Casablanca Airport with short stops at cafés or gas stations along the way. Drop-off at your departure terminal, or your accommodation in Casablanca if preferred.
End of your 10 day Moroccan tour.

includes: 10 Days Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver Speaking English.
Walking Tour in Chefchaouen with a Local Guide
Walking Tour in Fes with a Local Guide
Walking Tour in Marrakech with a Local Guide
Nights in Excellent Hotels / Riads.
Night in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms
Camel ride (Camel Per person), or a transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Desert Excursion in 4×4
Sand boards Available at The Camp
3 Dinners in Merzouga Camp & Dades Valley
Daily Breakfasts.
Casablanca Airport Transfers x2

We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

Since the transportation payment is fixed, the price will be divided according to the number of people. The price also depends on the quality of the accommodation. Contact us for an exact price.

listes.comment: The 10-day tour was an incredible experience! From Casablanca to the Sahara, every day offered something unique and unforgettable.

listes.comment: Amazing organization and beautiful locations. Riding camels in the Merzouga desert and visiting the Todra gorges were highlights.

Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, meet your driver to visit the iconic Majorelle Garden (requires online pre-booking), followed by a drive through Guell, the modern district of Marrakech, before returning to your Riad.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive west to Essaouira. On the way we will make stops to see the Argan trees plantations and cooperatives, and if you are lucky enough the goats on the trees. We reach Essaouira, formerly Mogador, one of the important coastal towns in Morocco. The city is famous for the diversity of seafood, beautiful beach and surfing sport. Free time to visit the fishing port, the ancient ramparts with cannons, and also the old Medina. Finally, transfer to your hotel. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Essaouira - Casablanca (4Hrs 20min Drive)
text: On the last day, we depart from Essaouira and head to Casablanca. Drop off at your departure terminal in Casablanca airport. Ideally, your flight should leave around 4pm or later. (It is Possible to End the Tour in Marrakech as Well)
End of the 11 days Morocco Discovery Tour.

Walking Tour in Fes with a Local Guide

listes.question: Is The 11 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The eleven-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 11-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 11-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 12 days Morocco Tour itinerary from Casablanca
tours.titre: 12 DAYS MOROCCO TOUR ITINERARY FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: Morocco 12 day tour from Casablanca. In these 12 days /11 nights, you will visit the four imperial cities and the Sahara desert. Starting the tour from north Morocco, visiting the city of Casablanca. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, and Chefchaouen the blue city. In addition to the Roman ruins of Volubilis, Meknes the Ismaili capital, and Fes the cultural city. Then we head south, visiting the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and also the cedars forest. As well as visiting Midelt, the Ziz valley, Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a camp in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, guided tour in Marrakech and Essaouira cities. The 12 day tour ends in Casablanca.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY 12 DAYS
programme.soustitre: 12 DAYS IN MOROCCO | TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Chefchaouen (5 hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive along the coastline to Rabat, one of the imperial cities in Morocco and the current capital. It is located in northwestern Morocco. You will visit the highlights of the Moroccan capital, including: Hassan tower, The Mausoleum of Mohammed V and The Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon we head north through Ouazzane, to reach the Blue city of Chefchaouen in the Rif Mountains. Overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Sightseeing Chefchaouen the blue city (No Driving - 2 Hours walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, we will explore Chefchaouen, the blue city. Also known as Achaoun, which means horns in Berber. The city is located in the Rif mountains northwest Morocco. It is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white and blue. Firstly we will stroll in its charming old Medina, which has so many beautiful authentic blue doors and whitewashed walls. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon you can hike to the Spanish mosque located on a high ground, where you can see the spectacular view of the whole blue city. Finally, return to your hotel.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Chefchaouen - The Roman Ruins of Wolubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis, well preserved and recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It has many beautiful mosaics, ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities, where we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes for an overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive / 3 Hours To 4 Hours walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities. Fes is the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking tour: step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Highlights include the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine, and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your Riad to relax.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest - Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow, and alpine-style architecture houses. Known as the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to the cedars forest, home to Barbary macaques. Later, we continue to Midelt for lunch.

We then drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass along the Ziz valley, with stops for panoramic views. In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, switch to camels, climb a high dune to enjoy the sunset, and continue to the camp for dinner and overnight stay.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads - Khamlia - Merzuga lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early to witness the sunrise in the desert. Free time for breakfast. Return by camels or 4x4 ride to Merzouga. Explore Merzouga region, visiting sand dunes, wild lake, oases, and fossil areas.

Visit an ancient eyeliner mine, meet nomads in their woven tents, learn about their lifestyle, enjoy Berber tea, then visit Khamlia village for Gnaoua music and dancing. Walk through the palm trees grove and see the Merzouga flamingos lake. Return to Merzouga for dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, leave the desert to visit Rissani, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Explore the Rissani souk. Then continue to Erfoud to visit fossilized marble workshops.
Drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, then visit the Todra Gorges, a red cliff canyon. Finally, continue to the Dades Valley for dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, visit Kalaa Magouna for the Rose valley and the annual Rose Festival. Continue through the palm groves of Skoura to Ouarzazate, visiting film studios.
Visit the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a UNESCO World Heritage Site featured in many movies. Drive through the High Atlas Mountains and Tizi-N-Tichka pass to Marrakech. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45 Min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, explore Marrakech highlights with a local guide. Visit Bahia Palace, Ben Youssef Madrasa, Jamaa El Fna Square, and Koutoubia Mosque. Free time for lunch. Visit Majorelle Garden and Gueliz district before returning to the Riad.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, drive west to Essaouira, stopping at Argan tree plantations and cooperatives. Visit the fishing port, ancient ramparts, and the old Medina. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 12th Day: Arrival to Marrakech (4 Hours 20 Min Drive)
text: Depart from Essaouira to Casablanca airport. End the 12 days Morocco Tour in Marrakech.

listes.comment: Absolutely unforgettable! The camel ride at sunset in Merzouga was magical, and the night in the luxury desert camp was beyond expectations. Chefchaouen and Fes were stunning. Our driver Youssef was incredibly knowledgeable and kind. Highly recommended!

listes.name: Emily Johnson - UK
listes.comment: Amazing trip! Every day was full of discoveries. The desert experience was my favourite part. A little bit of long driving, but totally worth it.

listes.name: Anna Müller - Germany
listes.comment: The Roman ruins of Volubilis and the old medina of Fes were the highlights for me. Beautiful accommodations and very professional driver.

listes.name: Laura Martínez - Spain
listes.comment: Chefchaouen was like a dream. The accommodations were beautiful and authentic. We highly recommend this 12-day tour.

listes.name: Khalid Al Mansouri - UAE
listes.comment: Very well planned. Private transportation was comfortable and our driver Hassan was amazing. Loved the luxury desert camp.

listes.name: Nadia Benali - Belgium
listes.comment: Les guides locaux à Fès et Marrakech étaient excellents. Le camp dans le désert était incroyable, très confortable. Rien à dire.

tours.to: 13 days In Morocco Tours from Casablanca
tours.titre: BEST 13 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: 13 days Around Morocco tour from Casablanca. In these 13 days / 12 nights you will visit almost every fabulous place in Morocco. Starting the tour from north Morocco, visiting the city of Casablanca. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, and Chefchaouen the blue city. In addition to the Roman ruins of Volubilis, Meknes the Ismaili capital, and Fes the cultural city. Then we head south, visiting the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and also the cedars forest. As well as visiting Midelt, the Ziz valley, Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp, in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, guided tour in Marrakech and a visit to Essaouira. The 13 day tour ends in Casablanca.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 13 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 12 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca - Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling dric center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Cafe, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note: The order and number of visits may vary based on your arrival schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Assilah (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive along the coastline to Rabat. Rabat is one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. We will visit the Highlights of the Moroccan capital. Including the Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and also the Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, we head north to Assilah the beautiful seaside city. Overnight stay in a hotel

jours.jour: 3rd Day : Assilah - Tangier - Rif Mountains - Chefchauen (2.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we depart from Assilah, and drive along the coastline to Tangier. Also known as 'the bride of the north'. It is located northwest, where the Mediterranean Sea ineets the Atlantic Ocean off Cape Spartel, in the Strait of Gibraltar. Firstly, we will explore the beautiful city, and visit the cave of Hercules and the Cape Spartel. Free time for lunch, before we drive inland to Chefchaouen. Passing through the city of Tetouan, and the Rif mountains. Stops will be made along the way for panoramic views. Finally, overnight stay in a hotel in Chefchaouen.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Sightseeing Chefchaouen the blue city (No Drive - 2 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, we will explore Chefchaouen, the blue city. Also known as Achaoun, which means horns in Berber. The city is located in the Rif mountains northwest Morocco. It is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white and blue. Firstly we will stroll in its charming old Medina, which has so many beautiful authentic blue doors and whitewashed wall. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon you can hike to the Spanish mosque,. Located on a high ground, where you can see the spectacular view of the whole blue city. Finally, return to your hotel. Overnight stay in the same hotel.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Chefchaouen The Roman ruins of Volubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways, of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities. In which we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive / 3Hrs to 4Hrs Walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine existing considered the oldest university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to Relax.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara  (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our 13 days around Morocco tour south through Imouzzer, to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style architecture houses. No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. With stops for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, where you switch to camels. Then cross the sandy desert, and make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the desert camp. Which is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads, and the luxury a hotel has. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads -Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels or a 4x4 ride to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the 8th day of your 13 days Around Morocco tour, to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music. And dancing performances of its inhabitants originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand high red cliff-sided canyon through the mountains. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitalle stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation, and for the view of the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura, before we reach Ouarzazate, where we visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. After that we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Overnight stay in a Riad in Marrakech.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45Min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After a warm breakfast, we will be exploring the Highlights of Marrakesh with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the Koutoubia Mosque from outside, the largest in the city.

Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, meet your driver to visit the iconic Majorelle Garden (requires online pre-booking), followed by a drive through Gueliz, the modern district of Marrakech, before returning to your Riad.

jours.jour: 12th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive west to Essaouira. On the way we will make stops to see the Argan trees plantations and cooperatives, and if you are lucky enough the goats on the trees. We reach Essaouira, formerly Mogador, one of the important coastal towns in Morocco. The city is famous for the diversity of seafood, beautiful beach and surfing sport. Free time to visit the fishing port, the ancient ramparts with cannons, and also the old Medina. Finally, transfer to your hotel. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 13th Day: Essaouira - Casablanca (4 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, we depart from Essaouira and head to Casablanca. Drop off at your departure terminal in Casablanca airport. Ideally, your flight should leave around 4pm or later. (It is Possible to End the Tour in Marrakech as Well)
End of the 13 days Morocco Tour.

listes.question: Is The 13 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The thirteen-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 13-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 13-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 14 days In Morocco Tours from Casablanca
tours.titre: BEST 14 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: 14 days grand Morocco tour from Casablanca. In these 14 days / 13 nights, you will visit every fabulous place in Morocco. Starting the tour from north Morocco, visiting the city of Casablanca. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, and Chefchaouen the blue city. In addition to the Roman ruins of Volubilis, Meknes the Ismaili capital, and Fes the cultural city. Then we head south, visiting the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and also the cedars forest, Midelt, the amazing Ziz valley. As well as visiting Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp, in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise, in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, guided tour in Marrakech and Essaouira cities. The 14 day tour ends in Casablanca

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 14 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 12 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca - Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling dric center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Cafe, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note: The order and number of visits may vary based on your arrival schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Assilah (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive along the coastline to Rabat. Rabat is one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. We will visit the Highlights of the Moroccan capital. Including the Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and also the Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, we head north to Assilah the beautiful seaside city. Overnight stay in a hotel

jours.jour: 3rd Day : Assilah - Tangier - Rif Mountains - Chefchauen (2.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we depart from Assilah, and drive along the coastline to Tangier. Also known as 'the bride of the north'. It is located northwest, where the Mediterranean Sea ineets the Atlantic Ocean off Cape Spartel, in the Strait of Gibraltar. Firstly, we will explore the beautiful city, and visit the cave of Hercules and the Cape Spartel. Free time for lunch, before we drive inland to Chefchaouen. Passing through the city of Tetouan, and the Rif mountains. Stops will be made along the way for panoramic views. Finally, overnight stay in a hotel in Chefchaouen.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Sightseeing Chefchaouen the blue city (No Drive - 2 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, we will explore Chefchaouen, the blue city. Also known as Achaoun, which means horns in Berber. The city is located in the Rif mountains northwest Morocco. It is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white and blue. Firstly we will stroll in its charming old Medina, which has so many beautiful authentic blue doors and whitewashed wall. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon you can hike to the Spanish mosque,. Located on a high ground, where you can see the spectacular view of the whole blue city. Finally, return to your hotel. Overnight stay in the same hotel.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Chefchaouen The Roman ruins of Volubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways, of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities. In which we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive / 3Hrs to 4Hrs Walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine existing considered the oldest university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to Relax.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara  (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our 13 days around Morocco tour south through Imouzzer, to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style architecture houses. No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them, while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have a free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley. With stops for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, where you switch to camels. Then cross the sandy desert, and make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the desert camp. Which is a combination between the traditional tents of nomads, and the luxury a hotel has. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music, while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads -Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels or a 4x4 ride to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the 8th day of your 14 days Around Morocco tour, to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music. And dancing performances of its inhabitants originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud -Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand high red cliff-sided canyon through the mountains. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitalle stops at the 'monkey fingers' rock formation, and for the view of the Dades valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura, before we reach Ouarzazate, where we visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. After that we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Overnight stay in a Riad in Marrakech.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45Min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After a warm breakfast, we will be exploring the Highlights of Marrakesh with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the Koutoubia Mosque from outside, the largest in the city.

Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, meet your driver to visit the iconic Majorelle Garden (requires online pre-booking), followed by a drive through Gueliz, the modern district of Marrakech, before returning to your Riad.

jours.jour: 12th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive west to Essaouira. On the way we will make stops to see the Argan trees plantations and cooperatives, and if you are lucky enough the goats on the trees. We reach Essaouira, formerly Mogador, one of the important coastal towns in Morocco. The city is famous for the diversity of seafood, beautiful beach and surfing sport. Free time to visit the fishing port, the ancient ramparts with cannons, and also the old Medina. Finally, transfer to your hotel. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 13th Day: Essaouira - Marrakech (3 Hours Drive)
text: Today, you can choose to spend more time exploring Essaouira at your own pace, or begin the drive back to Marrakech, enjoying the scenic coastal and countryside landscapes along the way. Upon arrival, check in to your accommodation and enjoy the rest of the day at your leisure relax, explore the souks, or unwind at a rooftop café.

jours.jour: 14th Day: Marrakesh or Casablanca Airports .
text: On the final day, transfer to Marrakech Airport at any time that suits your departure schedule. You may choose to end the tour in Casablanca as Well
End of The 14 Day Morocco Tour .

tours.to: 2 Days Tour From Fes To Merzouga Desert
tours.titre: BEST 2 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM FES

about.paragraph1: Morocco 2 day Sahara desert tour from Fes. In these 2 days / 1 night you will visit so many fabulous places in a short period of time. The tour starts from Fes the cultural city. Firstly, we will visit the Switzerland of Morocco tfrane, and the cedars forest. Then stop in Midelt for bunch, after that we drive along the amazing Ziz valley. Furthermore we will visit Rissani traditional market, Erfoud the fossils town and also the Sahara desert of Merzouga, Where you can ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp in the middle of the desert. And enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Finally, the tour ends in Fes

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 2 DAYS TOUR FROM FES

jours.jour: 1st day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: The 2 days Merzouga desert tour starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Fes. Then we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and also the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where lunch will be served. Then we head to the Sahara desert, driving through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass, and along the Ziz river

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Then switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. After that a stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert camp. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Merzouga - Rissani - Erfoud - Ziz valley Ifrane-Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you return on camels or a 4x4 ride to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble

After that we drive along the Ziz river, ve stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Then we drive through the cedars forest and Ifrane to reach Fes. Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation. End of the tour. Estimated Arrive time is around 6pm. End of the 2 days to Merzouga Desert
This Tour ends back in Fes, if You Wish to End The tour in Marrakech you can Consider: 2 Days from Fes to Marrakech

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 2-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 2-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 2 Days Tour From Fes To Marrakech
tours.titre: BEST 2 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM FES

about.paragraph1: 2 Days tour from Fes to Marrakech via Merzouga desert. In these 2 days / 1 night you will visit so many fabulous places in a short time. Firstly, we will leave Fes to visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and also the cedars forest. A stop in Midelt for lunch, then we drive along the amazing Ziz river. After that we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Then ride camels and spend the night in a desert camp in the middle of the desert. Furthermore, enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. After that, visit the Todra gorges and the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Finally, we cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The 2 day tour ends in Marrakech

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 2 DAYS TOUR FROM FES

jours.jour: 1st Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest- Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: The 2 days desert tour to Marrakech starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Fes. Then we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where lunch will be served. Then we head to the Sahara desert, driving through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass, and along the Ziz river

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert camp. Where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Merzouga Sahara Desert - Todra Gorges - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains -Marrakech (9 Hours Drive)
text: An early wake up is a must do to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, before you return on 4x4 ride to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert and drive west through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out à grand canyon through the mountains Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Then we drive along various Kasbahs, and palm tree groves to reach Ouarzazate, free time for lunch

Then we continue to Marrakesh by driving through the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, Making a Quick stop at the fortified village, it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including Gladiator Alexander The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. Finally, we drive through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the High Atlas Mountains to reach Marrakech. Then we drive you to the airport or your accommodation. End of the 2 day Fes to Marrakech tour
The Tour Ends In Marrakech, if you Wish to Drive Back to Fes you Can Consider: 2 Days from Fes to Merzouga

includes: 2 Days Transport in a private 4x4 or a Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver / Guide Speaking English
Pick-up from your Riad or any Location in Fes
1 Night in a Luxury Desert Camp, With Private Bathroom
Camel ride (a Camel Per person) or Transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Sandboards Available at the Camp
Dinner and Breakfast.
Drop Off at your Riad in Fes

important.text: Bear in mind that 10 Days trip is just a tour itinerary suggestion, if it does not match what you are looking for, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

priceText.text: Varies according to the number of people, the more people joining the tour the less the price gets. Since the transportation payment is fixed, the price will be divided according to the number of people. The price also depends on the quality of the accommodation. Contact us for an exact price.

listes.name: Laura – UK
listes.comment: Incredible experience! Even in 2 days, we saw so much – from the desert to the Atlas mountains. Camel ride and sunset were unforgettable.

listes.comment: Perfectly organized tour. The guide was very knowledgeable, and the desert camp was a magical experience.

listes.name: Sophie – France
listes.comment: Short but intense. Todra Gorges and Ait Ben Haddou were highlights. The driver was friendly and professional.

listes.name: Mark – USA
listes.comment: Great way to see Morocco in a short time. The camel ride and Berber music at the desert camp were amazing.
