text: After breakfast, the 13-day Absolute Morocco tour heads south via Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, known for cool weather, winter snow, and alpine-style chalets-the 'Switzerland of Morocco'. Continue to the Cedar Forest to see Barbary macaques in their natural habitat. Free time for lunch in Midelt. Drive over the Tizi-n-Tilghmt Pass and along the Ziz Valley with scenic stops. In the afternoon we reach Merzouga, where you switch to camels to cross the golden dunes, pausing on a high ridge for sunset. Continue to a luxury desert camp combining nomadic tradition with modern comfort. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a vast, star-filled sky.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove (2 Hours Off Road Drive)
text: After breakfast, dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga region-dunes, a seasonal lake, fossil areas, small mines, and lush oases-ideal for light off-road adventures. Visit an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then share tea with nomads in their woven tents. Continue to Khamlia village for Gnaoua music and dance; many residents trace roots to Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch. Stroll through a palm-tree grove and drive to the wild lake of Merzouga (often home to flamingos) before returning to Merzouga. Dinner and overnight in a  hotel.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Merzouga - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Waking up early for sunrise is a must. After breakfast, leave the desert for Rissani, the former capital of Tafilalet and still a major regional market, especially lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays. Continue to Erfoud to visit a fossil workshop. Drive via Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves to reach the Todra Gorge, where the river has carved a dramatic canyon-an iconic site for climbers. Free time for lunch. Proceed through Boumalne Dades to the Dades Valley, stopping at the 'Monkey Fingers' rock formations and a lookout over the valley. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah -High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna, to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura, before we reach Ouarzazate, where we visit the studios, in which famous movies were shot.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including: Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. After that we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Overnight stay in a Riad in Marrakech.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45 Min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After a warm breakfast, we will be exploring the Highlights of Marrakesh with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the Koutoubia Mosque from outside, the largest in the city.
visit the iconic Majorelle Garden (requires online pre-booking), followed by a drive through Gueliz, the modern district of Marrakech, before returning to your Riad.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive west to Essaouira. On the way we will make stops to see the Argan trees plantations and cooperatives, and if you are lucky enough the goats on the trees. We reach Essaouira, formerly Mogador, one of the important coastal towns in Morocco. The city is famous for the diversity of seafood, beautiful beach and surfing sport. Free time to visit the fishing port, the ancient ramparts with cannons, and also the old Medina. Finally, transfer to your hotel. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Essaouira - Visit Casablanca (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: Depart Essaouira and follow the highway north to Casablanca - Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca.
liste: Mohammed V Square the bustling civic center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Café, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca

jours.jour: 12th Day: Rabat sightseeing - Assilah (4 Hours Drive)
text: We drive along the coastline to Rabat. Rabat is one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. We will visit the Highlights of the Moroccan capital. Including : the Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and also the Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon, we head north to Assilah the beautiful seaside city. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 13th Day: Assilah - Transfer to Tangier (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, we depart from Assilah and head to Tangier. Drop off at your departure terminal in Casablanca airport.
End of the 13 Days Absolute Tour.

Private Driver Speaking English.

Nights in Excellent Riads.
Night in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms

listes.comment: An exceptional 13-day tour that truly shows the real Morocco. From the blue streets of Chefchaouen to the Sahara dunes and Atlantic coast, everything was perfectly organized.

listes.name: John – USA
listes.comment: This is the most complete Morocco itinerary you can imagine. Imperial cities, desert, mountains, and the ocean – every destination exceeded our expectations.

listes.name: Isabella – Italy
listes.comment: Amazing experience from start to finish. The riads, desert camp, guides, and driver were all excellent. We felt safe, relaxed, and well taken care of.

listes.name: Oliver – Australia

listes.question: Is The 13 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The thirteen-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 13-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 13-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 3 Days Tour From Errachidia To Merzouga Desert
tours.titre: BEST 3 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA TO MERZOUGA DESERT

about.paragraph1: 3 days tour to Merzouga desert from Errachidia. During these 3 days and 2 nights, you will explore the desert area. Visit the nomads in their tents, also enjoy the music of Gnaoua and dance performance of Khamlia people. After that take a look at an old eyeliner mine. In addition to Merzouga wild life lake a few kilometres away from Merzouga. Then stroll in the palm trees grove, ride camels, and enjoy the magical sunset and sunrise on the sand dunes. Furthermore you will spend a night in a camp located in the middle of the Sahara desert. Finally visit the traditional souk of Rissani and Erfoud the fossils town. The tour ends In Errachidia

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 3 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA

jours.jour: 1st day: Arrival to Errachidia - Merzouga (2 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 3 day Merzouga desert tour, we pick you up from Errachidia (ERH) Airport, or your Accommodation and drive south to the Sahara dunes of Merzouga. Overnight in Merzouga.
Flight option:
liste: Domestic flights from Marrakech, operate on 3 Days a week (Ryanair), Arrive between 7am or 3pm
Domestic flights from Casablanca operate on 7 Days a week (Royal Air Maroc). Arrive at Midnight.
jours.note: Note :(We can modify the itinerary to suit your arrival time)

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia ( Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi -Palm Grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases-ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingos' lake).

Later, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxur camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Merzouga - Rissani - Erfoud - Errachidia Airport (2 Hours Drive)
text: Sunrise is highly recommended. After breakfast, return by camels or a 4x4 ride to where your driver awaits. (Some of these places can be visited on the first Day, or Entirely skipped Based on your Flight timing), we visit Rissani-the former capital of Tafilalet and a lively market town on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays-then continue to Erfoud to see a fossil workshop. Drive north toward Errachidia with scenic stops, including a panoramic viewpoint over the Ziz Valley. Drop off at Errachidia Airport, Early Morning or at Midday. End of the desert tour.

tours.to: 3 Days Tour From Errachidia To Fes
tours.titre: BEST 3 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA TO FES

about.paragraph1: 3 days Merzouga Desert tour from Errachidia to Fes. During these 3 days and 2 nights, you will explore the desert area. Visit the nomads in their tents, also enjoy the music of Gnaoua and dance performance of Khamlia people. After that take a look at an old eyeliner mine. In addition to Merzouga wild life lake a few kilometres away from Merzouga. Then stroll in the palm trees grove, ride camels, and enjoy the magical sunset and sunrise on the sand dunes. Furthermore you will spend a night in a camp located in the middle of the Sahara desert. You will also visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Finally, the tour ends in Fes.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 3 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA

jours.jour: 1st day: Arrival to Errachidia - Merzouga (2 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 3 day Merzouga desert tour, we pick you up from Errachidia (ERH) Airport, or your Accommodation and drive south to the Sahara dunes of Merzouga. Overnight in Merzouga.
Flight option:
liste: Domestic flights from Marrakech, operate on 3 Days a week (Ryanair), Arrive between 7am or 3pm
Domestic flights from Casablanca operate on 7 Days a week (Royal Air Maroc). Arrive at Midnight.
jours.note: Note :(We can modify the itinerary to suit your arrival time)

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia ( Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi -Palm Grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases-ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingos' lake).

In the afternoon, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxur camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd day: Merzouga Dunes - Rissani - Erfoud -Midelt - Cedar Forest - Ifrane - Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 3 day desert tour to Fes, wake up early to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. After breakfast, return by camel to Merzouga, where your driver awaits. We then leave the desert to visit Rissani, the ancient capital of Tafilalet and still a major trading centre with a lively souk on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays. After a stroll in the souk, continue to Erfoud to visit a workshop of fossilised marble.

Afterward, drive along the Ziz River and stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz Valley. Enjoy free time for lunch in Midelt. Continue to the Cedar Forest, where the Barbary macaques live feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Next, visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperatures, winter snow, and alpine-style houses-no wonder it is called the 'Switzerland of Morocco'. Finally, we drop you off at any location within in Fes. End of the tour.

Domestic flights from Casablanca operate on 7 Days a week (Royal Air Maroc). Arrive at Midnight.
jours.note: Note :(We can modify the itinerary to suit your arrival time)

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia ( Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi -Palm Grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases-ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingos' lake).

In the afternoon, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxur camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Merzouga Sahara - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - Marrakech (7 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early to witness the beautiful sunrise in the heart of the desert. Enjoy breakfast, then return to Merzouga, meet your driver, and head west. We will stop for viewpoints and café breaks before reaching Ouarzazate, where you'll have free time for lunch.

After lunch, continue toward Marrakech via the famous ksar of Aït Benhaddou, a UNESCO World Heritage site featured in films such as Gladiator, Alexander, and The Mummy, as well as the series Game of Thrones. Cross the Tizi-n-Tichka Pass through the High Atlas Mountains to arrive in Marrakech, then transfer to the airport or your accommodation. End of the desert tour.
jours.note: Note :If the 9 hour drive back to Marrakech feels too much for you:
liste: The tour can end in Errachidia airport, 2 hours from Merzouga, and it is one hour flight to Marrakech. Flight is not Included, Airline: Ryanair, schedule: 3 Times a week
Or Add an Additional Day to break the 9 hours drive and visit more places, you can consider: 4 Days from Errachidia to Merzouga & Marrakech

includes: 3 Days Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver Speaking English.
2 Nights in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms
Camel ride (Camel Per person), or a transfer via a 4WD as an alternative
Sand boards Available at The Camp
Pick up from Any location in Errachidia (Airport, your Hotel...etc)
Drop Off at your Accommodation in Marrakech
Desert Excursion in 4×4
Dinner and Breakfast.

listes.question: Is The 3 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The three-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 3-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 3-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 4 Days Merzouga Desert Tour from Errachidia to Marrakech
tours.titre: 4 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA TO MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: 4-day Merzouga desert tour from Errachidia. During these 4 days and 3 nights, you will explore the desert area. Visit the nomads in their tents, and enjoy the music of Gnawa and dance performances of the Khamlia people. After that, take a look at an old eyeliner mine and Merzouga Wildlife Lake, a few kilometers away. Then, stroll through the palm groves, ride camels, and enjoy the magical sunset and sunrise on the sand dunes. You will spend a night in a camp located in the middle of the Sahara Desert. Then, we visit the Dades Valley, Todra Gorge, and the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. We cross the High Atlas Mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY : 4 DAYS DESERT TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Errachidia - Merzouga (2 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 4-day Merzouga desert tour, we pick you up from Errachidia (ERH) Airport or your accommodation and drive south to the Sahara dunes of Merzouga. Overnight in Merzouga.
Flight options
listes: Domestic flights from Marrakech operate 3 days a week (Ryanair), arriving between 7:00 AM and 3:00 PM.
Domestic flights from Casablanca operate 7 days a week (Royal Air Maroc), arriving at midnight.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia (Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove (2 Hours drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases—ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingo lake).

Later, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxury camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight stay in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani remains a major trading center in the region, with a large souk bustling on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays.

After a stroll through Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the fossilized marble workshops. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves to reach the Todra Gorge. The Todra River has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains, creating a high, red, cliff-sided canyon. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch at a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades Valley, via Boumalne Dades. We make an inevitable stop at the 'Monkey Fingers' rock formation and at a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades Valley. Finally, dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Dades Valley - Rose Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 4-day desert tour, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose Valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May, where locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, and oil to cosmetics. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura. Later, we reach Ouarzazate, also known as the gateway to the desert. We will visit the studios where famous movies were filmed.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many films, including Gladiator, Alexander, and The Mummy, as well as TV series such as Game of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the spectacular High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch and to take pictures at interesting spots. Finally, we arrive in Marrakech and drop you off at the airport or your accommodation. (End of the tour)

Private Driver Speaking English.
Nights in Excellent Riads in Boulmane Dades.
2 Nights in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms
Camel ride (Camel Per person), or a transfer via a 4WD as an alternative

Desert Excursion in 4×4

tours.to: 2 Days Tour From Ouarzazate To Merzouga And Fes
tours.titre: BEST 2 DAYS TOUR FROM OUARZAZATE TO MERZOUGA AND FES

about.paragraph1: 2 Days Desert Tour from Ouarzazate to Fes. In these 2 days / 1 night you will visit so many fabulous places in a short time. The tour starts with a visit to the Todra gorges. Then to Merzouga Sahara desert. Where you ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaque live. Finally, the tour ends in Fes.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 2 DAYS TOUR FROM OUARZAZATE

jours.jour: 1st Day: Ouarzazate - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes Camel trekking overnight in a luxury camp (6 Hours Drive)
text: We pick you up from your accommodation or the airport in Ouarzazate early in the morning, then drive through the Todra Valley, the course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains -Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. After that we drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Free time for lunch on the way.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Merzouga Dunes Erfoud Midelt cedars forest - Ifrane - Fes (7 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your desert tour. Wake up early morning to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast, then you return on camels to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshop of fossilized marble

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation in Fes. End of the 2 days Ouarzazate to Fes desert tour

includes: 2 Days Transport in a private 4x4 or a Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver / Guide Speaking English.
Pick-up from your Riad or any Location in Ouarzazate

liste: The tour ends in Fes, you wish to Travel to Marrakech, you can consider: 3 Days From Ouarzazate toMarrakech

Private Driver / Guide Speaking English.

We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

priceText.text: Varies according to the number of people, the more people joining the tour the less the price gets. Since the transportation payment is fixed, the price will be divided according to the number of people. The price also depends on the quality of the accommodation. Contact us for an exact price.

listes.name: Laura – Italy
listes.comment: An unforgettable 3-day journey from Ouarzazate to Fes. The Todra Gorges, camel trek, and luxury desert camp were absolutely amazing.

listes.name: David – United Kingdom
listes.comment: Perfect balance between adventure and comfort. Exploring Merzouga by 4x4 and spending nights in the desert camp was a highlight.

listes.name: Nora – Germany
listes.comment: Well-organized tour with a very professional driver. The sunrise in the Sahara and the visit to Rissani market were truly memorable.

listes.name: Lucas – Brazil
listes.comment: Fantastic way to reach Fes while discovering southern Morocco. Ifrane and the cedar forest were a beautiful contrast after the desert.

listes.question: Is The 3 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The three-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 3-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: 4 Land Cruiser Prado (up to 4 passengers)
Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 3-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 3 Days Tour From Ouarzazate To Merzouga And Marrakech
tours.titre: BEST 3 DAYS TOUR FROM OUARZAZATE TO MERZOUGA AND MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: 3 days desert tour from Ouarzazate. In these 3 days / 2 nights you will visit so many fabulous places in a short time. The tour starts by visiting Todra gorges. Then drive to Merzouga Sahara desert. Where ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Explore the Sahara desert of Merzouga in a 4x4 car, visit Rissani traditional market. Then drive along Draa valley, visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Finally, cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 3 DAYS TOUR FROM OUARZAZATE

jours.jour: 1st Day: Ouarzazate Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes Camel trekking overnight in a luxury camp (6 Hours Drive)
text: We pick you up from your accommodation or the airport in Ouarzazate early in the morning, then drive through the Todra Valley, the course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains -Making a high red cliff-sided canyon. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. After that we drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad. Free time for lunch on the way.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia ( Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi -Palm Grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases-ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingos' lake).

Later, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxury camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Merzouga Sahara - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - Marrakech (9 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early to witness the beautiful sunrise in the heart of the desert. Enjoy breakfast, then return to Merzouga, meet your driver, and head west. We will stop for viewpoints and café breaks before reaching Ouarzazate, where you'll have free time for lunch.

After lunch, continue toward Marrakech via the famous ksar of Aït Benhaddou, a UNESCO World Heritage site featured in films such as Gladiator, Alexander, and The Mummy, as well as the series Game of Thrones. Cross the Tizi-n-Tichka Pass through the High Atlas Mountains to arrive in Marrakech, then transfer to the airport or your accommodation. End of the desert tour.
jours.note: Note :If the 9 hour drive back to Marrakech feels too much for you:
liste: The tour can end in Errachidia airport, 2 hours from Merzouga, and it is one hour flight to Marrakech. Flight is not Included, Airline: Ryanair, schedule: 3 Times a week

listes.name: Sophia – USA
listes.comment: Amazing 3-day adventure! From Todra Gorges to the Sahara, every moment was magical. Camel trekking and the desert camp exceeded my expectations.

listes.name: Thomas – France
listes.comment: Well-planned tour with comfortable transportation and a knowledgeable driver. Seeing Ait Ben Haddou and crossing the High Atlas was unforgettable.

listes.name: Maria – Spain
listes.comment: A perfect mix of adventure and culture. The sunset on the dunes and the Berber music around the campfire were highlights.

listes.name: Ahmed – UAE
listes.comment: Excellent 3-day desert tour. Everything was smooth, from pickup to drop-off in Marrakech. Highly recommend it!

listes.name: Isabelle – Canada
listes.comment: The journey was breathtaking. Todra gorges, Merzouga desert, and the Atlas mountains made it a once-in-a-lifetime experience.
